resources.string: &appname; needs access to your device storage to save the picture you just took.
Augmented Reality Mode uses Google\'s ARCore. You may be prompted to install or update ARCore.
&appname; provides some great stickers featuring the world\'s best dog, Finn, and a hand puppet and almost-chew-toy named Cowwy.

If your phone has Google\'s keyboard app, Gboard, it will show stickers from this app. You can also share stickers from inside the &appname; app, and &appname; will be an option wherever you can choose a file to attach to a message.
You\'ll need to install each sticker pack you want to use, and you can do this easily from the &appname; main screen.

Augmented Reality lets you place computer-generated objects in the real world as seen through your phone\'s camera. &appname; will need camera permissions, as well as storage access to let you take pictures in this mode.
To start, gently move your phone in circles (with the camera pointing in the same direction). You\'ll see a grid of dots appear on any flat surfaces detected.
At the top of the screen, you can select stickers and 3D models. Then tap one of those detected surfaces in the camera view to place the object.

You can drag objects around, or you can tap one and then pinch or twist to resize or rotate it. The Delete button up top will clear the last thing you placed. Hold it to clear everything.\n\nHave fun!
